channel.title: Drop.cfg
channel.description:
i was wondering why there was drop.cgf after noticing its useless casue droping items is for npchandler and the item.java's now i think i figured it out but i aint sure at all. sence with item.java you cant set item amounts when drops, all ya can put is the randome drop ids. im guessing the drop.cgf is for setting amounts, you creat the random drop then you just fill out drop amounts with drp.cgf cause it sucks having monsters drop 1gp only :\
or am i real wrong still and its useless? or right this time :P? yes im new to java....

item.title: Drop.cfg
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

go into itemhandler.java. It’ll have the loading of drop.cfg. Read through that.

Read full topic

item.title: Drop.cfg
item.dc:creator: @NojTB NojTB
item.description:
@NojTB wrote:

i was wondering why there was drop.cgf after noticing its useless casue droping items is for npchandler and the item.java’s
now i think i figured it out but i aint sure at all.
sence with item.java you cant set item amounts when drops, all ya can put is the randome drop ids. im guessing the drop.cgf is for setting amounts, you creat the random drop then you just fill out drop amounts with drp.cgf
cause it sucks having monsters drop 1gp only :\

or am i real wrong still and its useless? or right this time :P?
yes im new to java…
